bioghist.p: Morgan Hebard (1887-1946) was an entomologist at the Academy of Natural Sciences. Hebard began studying and collecting Orthoptera as a young man; at the age of sixteen his association with the Academy began when he consulted the staff to determine some of his Lepidoptera specimens. After his graduation in 1910, he worked for a year in banking, before resigning to spend his time on research. He continued to collect and study Orthoptera until his death, shortly before which he presented his collection of approximately 250,000 specimens to the Academy.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
